subject: Re: [junit] testing for Set or List returning methods
msgSnippet: ... The assertThat method can be used to test properties of collections. E.g. assertThat(aList, containsElement( foo )) The collections interfaces guarantee
messageBody:
On 15/01/2008, PankajKHARE <pankaj.0405@...> wrote:
>
>
> how to write junit test case of method which are return Set or List.
>
> for Example public Set getXXX();
> --
>







The assertThat method can be used to test properties of collections. E.g.

assertThat(aList, containsElement("foo"))

The collections interfaces guarantee that Set and List have meaningful
implementations of equals, so it's also valid to test for equality:

import static java.utils.Arrays.asList;
...

assertThat(aList, equalTo(asList("foo", "bar", "baz")));

--Nat


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
